description: Fundamental mount position sitting on opponent's stomach/hips with knees near their hips
key_points: Sit on opponent's stomach or hips|Knees tight to their sides|Toes hooked under thighs or grapevined|Maintain weight forward and low
common_mistakes: Sitting too upright|Knees too far from body|No hooks|Weight too far back

description: Advanced mount position with knees in opponent's armpits sitting on upper chest
key_points: Walk knees up toward armpits|Sit on chest/upper sternum|Control arms with knees|Head control with hands
common_mistakes: Not walking high enough|Losing balance|Knees not controlling arms|Weight back
counters: Bench press escape|Creating space|Turning to side

description: Mount variation with one knee beside head and other foot curled under opponent's armpit
key_points: One knee beside opponent's head|Other leg curled with foot under armpit|Trap near arm under leg|Ready for armbar
common_mistakes: Poor leg positioning|Arm not trapped|Losing balance|Too much space

description: Mount with legs grapevined inside opponent's legs for maximum control and base
key_points: Hook feet inside opponent's legs|Extend to flatten opponent|Heavy chest pressure|Control at head or underhooks
common_mistakes: Hooks too shallow|Not extending|Weight too high|Allowing space
counters: Knee to elbow|Bridge and roll|Creating space

description: Ezekiel choke from grapevine mount threading through sleeve
key_points: From grapevine mount, arm behind head|Thread hand through own sleeve|Blade of forearm across throat|Squeeze and flatten
common_mistakes: Forearm not on throat|Losing mount|Telegraphing|Loose sleeve grip

description: Trapping opponent's arm for submission setups from mount
key_points: From mount, isolate one arm|Control at wrist with two hands|Walk knee up to armpit|Keep arm trapped and controlled
common_mistakes: Losing arm control|Not securing properly|Giving space|Poor positioning

description: Fundamental cross collar choke from mount with deep grips signature of Roger Gracie
key_points: Establish deep collar grip palm up|Second hand crosses over with thumb in|Pull elbows tight|Squeeze forearms together
common_mistakes: Grips not deep|Elbows flaring|Not controlling posture|Hands too close

description: Fundamental shoulder lock using figure-four grip on bent arm from mount
key_points: Isolate arm and pin wrist to mat|Figure-four grip on wrist|Elbow to mat|Paint wrist toward opponent's hip
common_mistakes: Elbow not pinned|Loose grip|Too high|Arm not bent

description: Armbar from mount transitioning through S-mount position
key_points: Isolate arm from mount|Transition to S-mount|Swing leg over face|Pinch knees and extend hips
common_mistakes: Losing arm control|Falling off|Too much space|Not pinching knees

description: Kimura shoulder lock from mount when opponent's arm is extended or posting
key_points: Control wrist when arm extends|Sit up and figure-four grip|Rotate arm behind back|Keep weight on opponent
common_mistakes: Losing mount|Loose grip|Not sitting up|Allowing escape

description: Choke encircling head and arm from mount finishing from side or mount
key_points: Walk opponent's arm across their face|Encircle head and arm|Lock hands|Finish from mount or dismount
common_mistakes: Arm not across face|Loose grip|Poor angle|Not tight

description: Setting up triangle choke from mount when one arm in one arm out
key_points: From mount, create one arm in one out|Swing leg over trapped arm and neck|Lock triangle|Finish mounted or transition
common_mistakes: Poor arm positioning|Loose triangle|Falling off|Not cutting angle

description: Controlling opponent's arm trapped across their own body from mount
key_points: Trap opponent's arm across their body|Control at wrist|Maintain mount position|Set up back take or choke
common_mistakes: Losing control|Not maintaining mount|Arm escaping|Poor positioning

description: Taking the back from mount when opponent turns away or using gift wrap
key_points: From mount or gift wrap control|When opponent turns, follow|Insert hooks|Establish seatbelt
common_mistakes: Losing control|Not following|Poor timing|No hooks

description: Techniques to maintain mount when opponent is escaping
key_points: Keep weight forward and low|Post with hands when bridged|Slide knee back when they shrimp|Stay tight to opponent
common_mistakes: Sitting too upright|Posting too late|Giving space|Weight back

description: One foot posted with knee across opponent's body used for transitions
key_points: One foot flat on mat|Other knee across opponent|Ready to transition|Maintain control with pressure
common_mistakes: Poor foot position|Losing balance|Not controlling|Gap underneath

description: Transitioning from mount to knee on belly for different attack angles
key_points: From technical mount, lift to knee on belly|Maintain control throughout|Pressure with knee|Control with grips
common_mistakes: Losing control|Too much space|Poor pressure|No grips

description: Wrist lock from mount when opponent is defending chokes with hands
key_points: Isolate wrist when defending neck|Control forearm|Apply wrist hyperflexion|Gradual pressure
common_mistakes: Not isolating|Too fast|Poor angle|Loose control

description: Omoplata variation executed from mount position
key_points: From mount, trap arm similar to omoplata|Use leg to control shoulder|Apply shoulder pressure|Finish from mount
common_mistakes: Losing mount|Poor arm control|Not enough pressure|Arm escaping

description: Choke variation from mount using collar grip and forearm pressure
key_points: From high mount, deep collar grip|Forearm across throat|Use other hand for pressure|Squeeze and press
common_mistakes: Grip not deep|Poor forearm placement|Losing position|Not tight
